Sentencas: The design of active cathode catalysts, with abundant active sites and outstanding catalytic activity for CO2 electroreduction, is important to promote the development of solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs).
Titulo: Achieving Highly Efficient Carbon Dioxide Electrolysis by In Situ Construction of the Heterostructure

Sentencas: Herein, A-site-deficient perovskite oxide (La0.2Sr0.8)(0.9)Ti0.5Mn0.4Cu0.1O3-delta (LSTMC) is synthesized and studied as a promising cathode for SOECs.
Titulo: Achieving Highly Efficient Carbon Dioxide Electrolysis by In Situ Construction of the Heterostructure

Sentencas: Cu nanoparticles can be rapidly and uniformly in situ-exsolved under reducing conditions.
Titulo: Achieving Highly Efficient Carbon Dioxide Electrolysis by In Situ Construction of the Heterostructure

Sentencas: The heterostructure formed by the exsoluted Cu and LSTMC provides abundant active sites for the catalytic conversion of CO2 to CO.
Titulo: Achieving Highly Efficient Carbon Dioxide Electrolysis by In Situ Construction of the Heterostructure

Sentencas: Combined with the remarkable oxygen-ion transport capacity of the LSTMC substrate, the specially designed Cu@LSTMC cathode exhibits a dramatically improved electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Achieving Highly Efficient Carbon Dioxide Electrolysis by In Situ Construction of the Heterostructure

Sentencas: Furthermore, first-principles calculations proposed a mechanism for the adsorption and activation of CO2 by the heterostructure.
Titulo: Achieving Highly Efficient Carbon Dioxide Electrolysis by In Situ Construction of the Heterostructure

Sentencas: Electrochemically, the Cu@LSTMC presents a high current density of 2.82 A cm(-2) at 1.8 V and 800 degrees C, which is about 2.5 times higher than that of LSTM (1.09A cm(-2)).
Titulo: Achieving Highly Efficient Carbon Dioxide Electrolysis by In Situ Construction of the Heterostructure
